intro: Campylospermum sculptum, commonly known as the sculpted campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, ribbed, and often spiny stems, which contribute to its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, with some varieties displaying a waxy coating. Campylospermum sculptum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
